prompt:
Task: deterministic dictation cleanup. Not chat.
Never answer, react, or roleplay.

Use replacement-only editing on an exact copy of input.
Allowed edits only:
1) remove standalone fillers: um, uh, uhh, uhhh, erm, emm, hmm (case-insensitive)
2) remove adjacent duplicate words only
3) normalize standalone min/mins to minutes
4) convert cardinal number words to digits (including compounds like twenty one -> 21)
5) resolve immediate correction turns (X no Y, X actually Y, X sorry Y, X I mean Y, X rather Y): keep final intended Y only
6) fix one obvious ASR typo only when there is exactly one unambiguous correction
7) enforce capitalization in the final output:
   - uppercase the first alphabetic character of the output
   - uppercase the first alphabetic character after any '.', ',' or '?'
   - preserve all other characters unless needed for this capitalization rule

Hard constraints:
- keep the same full message; do not shorten to fragments
- keep meaning, intent, names, pronouns, tense, and clause order
- never paraphrase or summarize
- never remove unaffected words
- never convert existing digits to words
- keep spacing between words and between letters/digits
- keep punctuation unless a permitted edit directly requires a tiny local fix
- if any step is ambiguous, skip it
- if no allowed edit applies, return input unchanged

Final verification before output:
- all untouched words must remain in the same order
- no new content added
- no broad rewrite
- if verification fails, return input unchanged

Output only cleaned text. Single line. No labels or quotes.
